channel.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
channel.description: Alright so my old pc has been recently having problems with the internet, and I've been trying to solve this for a week now with no signs of success. I have looked in the problem and it seems that the problem is in windows vista, because a lot of other people have been having that problem with windows vista. I decided to completely remove windows vista and dual boot windows 7 and a linux distro (probably openSUSE). I'm facing a problem however, and I kind of don't know what to do. The cd reader in my laptop isn't working, and I just called the manufacturers and they said that my laptop was out of warranty by 1 month so no go there. I don't know what to do really. Do I just install win7 on another partition then replace vista with the linux distro? Note that this is my first time installing a linux distro (and my first time completely installing an os myself - my dad usually takes care of these things) so I don't know what to do. Any help?

item.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:10, topic:403917”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=500976.msg3664896#msg3664896 date=1310569011]
You can.
[/quote]
Ah that’s what I needed. I’m also assuming that the usb will still be usable as, well, a usb right?[/quote]

Still usable as a USB storage device yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Use AVG PC Tuneup… I used it and it deleted my OS Lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Ollie:

You can.

Ah that’s what I needed. I’m also assuming that the usb will still be usable as, well, a usb right?

Mopman:

Its also pretty easy to pxe boot a Windows Vista/7 installer.

I looked over pxe but I couldn’t understand it. All I understood was that it was a protocol for… something?

[quote=“sppt, post:9, topic:403917”]http://www.sevenforums.com/tutorials/7943-install-windows-7-fast-without-dvd-usb-device.html

Get a windows 7 iso
Don’t burn to DVD or put on flash drive, yet still you install windows
???
PROFIT

And it’s all done in like 10 minutes.[/quote]
That’s definitely cool but not what I want. I’d prefer if I could completely get rid of the vista install and have the win7 install operational before I start downloading the linux distro I’ll use.

Read full topic

item.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

sevenforums.com

Install Windows 7 FAST without a DVD or USB device - Windows 7 Help Forums

Windows 7 Forums is the largest help and support community, providing friendly help and advice for Microsoft Windows 7 Computers such as Dell, HP, Acer, Asus or a custom build.

Get a windows 7 iso
Don’t burn to DVD or put on flash drive, yet still you install windows
???
PROFIT

And it’s all done in like 10 minutes.

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

Linux can be installed from a flash drive, I don’t know about windows. Of course you could always fix the CD reader or get an external one.

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:

tL: The problem is in the cd reader part. Maybe my brain isn’t working but I can’t think of any way to install both while the cd reader is not functional

item.title: Completely uninstalling an OS
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[14:19] format
[14:19] the disk

Or, just install Windows 7 over Vista. Shrink the partition you have Windows on, make a new partition for Linux, install Linux on that partition.

Read full topic
